command.name: commands
command.description: Prints the list of commands available to you. This list may differ depending on server settings and your permissions.

command.name: replay
command.description: Toggles whether the replay of the race is recorded.

command.name: start
command.description: Basically clicks on the green “Ready” button.

command.name: config
command.description: Changes game mode and difficulty if allowed.

command.name: spectate
command.description: Toggles autospectate mode.

command.name: addons
command.description: Lists addons installed for all players that can play, in random order. Limits the list to a certain addon type if specified.

command.name: moreaddons
command.description: Lists top 5 addons that are missing for at least one player, sorted by the number of players that don’t have the addon ascending, random for equal number of players. Limits the list to a certain addon type if specified.

command.name: checkaddon
command.description: Displays numbers of players who have the corresponding addon, and whether server has it. Displays up to 5 random players from each category.

command.name: listserveraddon
command.description: Lists addons installed on the server that have a specified substring in their id. Limits the list to a certain addon type if specified.

command.name: playerhasaddon
command.description: Checks whether a player has a certain addon.

command.name: kick
command.permissions: crowns if server allows, hammers; votable
command.description: Kicks a player from the server.

command.name: kickban
command.description: Kicks a player from the server and temporarily bans him.

command.name: unban
command.description: Removes a temporary ban from a player.

command.name: ban
command.description: Adds a temporary ban to a player without kicking.

command.name: playeraddonscore
command.description: Returns the number (not the percentage!) of addons of different types installed by a player.

command.name: serverhasaddon
command.description: Checks whether the server has a certain addon.

command.name: mute
command.description: Temporarily blocks player’s messages from reaching you (until the server restart).

command.name: unmute
command.description: Unblocks player’s messages from reaching you.

command.name: listmute
command.description: Lists players whom you blocked using /mute command.

command.name: moreinfo
command.description: Displays an additional server message.

command.name: gnu
command.description: Starts kart elimination with Gnu (or a specified kart).

command.name: nognu
command.description: Cancels kart elimination.

command.name: tell
command.description: Makes a report to the server owner (if the server has a database to store the reports).

command.name: standings
command.description: Displays standings of grand prix or kart elimination, picks whatever of them is played now.

command.name: teamchat
command.description: Limits your future messages to be sent only to your teammates.

command.name: to
command.description: Limits your future messages to be sent only to specified usernames.

command.name: public
command.description: Allows your future messages to be sent to everyone.

command.name: record
command.description: Receives the server record for the race settings if there is any (and if the server has a database to store the records).

command.name: power
command.description: Enters the hammer mode if the password is correct.

command.name: length
command.description: Manipulates the length of the games, “= n” fixes the number of laps to n, “x k” sets it to k times default number of laps, “check” displays the setting, “clear” allows players to choose it freely.

command.name: queue
command.description: Manipulates the track queue aka the next played tracks. “show” displays it, “push” adds the track to the end of the queue, “pop” removes a track at the front. You can use “_back” and “_front” to specify on which end of the queue to add or remove the tracks.

command.name: adminstart
command.description: Toggles whether the game can be started on the server.

command.name: shuffle
command.description: Toggles whether the Grand Prix grid is shuffled before each race (1), or it corresponds to the standings (0).

command.name: timeout
command.description: Sets the timeout in seconds, whatever it may mean.

command.name: team
command.description: Move a player to one of six teams denoted by square emojis (r - red, o - orange, y - yellow, g - green, b - blue, p – purple), or removes the player from the teams (“-”).

command.name: cat+
command.description: Adds the player to a certain category.

command.name: cat-
command.description: Removes the player from a certain category.

command.name: cat*
command.description: Toggles whether a category is displayed in the player list.

command.name: troll
command.description: Toggles anti-troll system.

command.name: hitmsg
command.description: Toggles whether the messages about teammate hits are displayed.

command.name: teamhit
command.description: Toggles whether the teammate hits are punished ingame.

command.name: version
command.description: Displays version.

command.name: clear
command.description: Puts newlines onto the screen so that the previous messages are not visible.

command.name: register
command.description: The command is used to register to an event (if the server has a database to store the registrations). Players can provide information while registering.

command.name: token
command.description: Produces a token for a player and stores it in the database (if the server has a database to store tokens). Tokens may be used to authenticate players using their STK accounts.

command.name: muteall
command.description: Toggles whether a player wants to receive messages from anyone except acting players and referees in soccer tournament mode (this may be forced for acting player and referees using config).

command.name: game
command.description: Prepares the server for a certain game, with certain duration or number of goals.

command.name: role
command.description: Assigns a role to a player. Roles include: “r” and “b” - acting players with red and blue colors, respectively; “j” - judge/referee, “s” – spectator. May be done simultaneously for a specified category. Fails if the player doesn't satisfy the requirements for the role.

command.name: stop
command.description: Disables goal counting during the game.

command.name: go
command.description: Enables goal counting during the game.

command.name: play
command.description: Enables goal counting during the game.

command.name: resume
command.description: Enables goal counting during the game.

command.name: lobby
command.description: Forces players to the lobby through the final screen, stoppng the game.

command.name: init
command.description: Initializes the match score to start from (red count):(blue count) instead of 0:0.

command.name: vote
command.description: Casts a vote for the provided command, if it can be voted. Only useful for those players who can enforce their command but opt to vote instead of forcing; for those players who cannot invoke the command alone, /(command) is equivalent to /vote (command).

command.name: mimiz
command.description: A joke command.

command.name: test
command.description: A test command.

command.name: help
command.description: Gives description of a given command.

command.name: slots
command.description: Sets the number of playable slots to a certain value.

command.name: time
command.description: Displays server time.

command.name: addondownloadprogress
command.description: Displays the progress of background addon installation.

command.name: stopaddondownload
command.description: Stops the background download.

command.name: installaddon
command.description: Installs an addon by the identifier, or a zip archive with addons by the http(s) link.

command.name: uninstalladdon
command.description: Uninstalls an addon by its identifier.

command.name: music
command.description: Changes music volume (but not the sound effects volume).

command.name: addonrevision
command.description: Displays addon revision by addon's identifier.

command.name: liststkaddon
command.description: Displays the game addons by the substring of the identifier.

command.name: listlocaladdon
command.description: Displays locally installed addons by the substring of the identifier.
